card.name: Stenchskipper
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of the end step, if you control no Goblins, sacrifice Stenchskipper.
card.flavor:
"Many believe it to be the manifestation of all that is vile about the boggarts. I believe it should be avoided—from upwind, if possible."
—Cenn Deagan
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : This ability checks whether you control any Goblins twice each turn: once when the ability would trigger, and once when it resolves. If you control any Goblins at either time, you won't sacrifice Stenchskipper. (If you control any Goblins at the time the ability would trigger, it doesn't trigger at all.)

card.name: Stingmoggie
card.ability:
Stingmoggie enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.
{3}{R}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Stingmoggie: Destroy target artifact or land.
card.flavor: A path vexed by the stingmoggie was probably the wrong path anyhow.

card.name: Stinkdrinker Bandit
card.ability:
Prowl {1}{B} (You may cast this for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player this turn with a Goblin or Rogue.)
Whenever a Rogue you control attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : This ability triggers after blockers are declared during the declare blockers step. Each attacking Rogue you control gets +2/+1 if no creatures were assigned to block it. That creature will get the bonus even if an effect causes it to become blocked.
4/15/2013 : An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

card.name: Stomping Slabs
card.ability: Reveal the top seven cards of your library, then put those cards on the bottom of your library in any order. If a card named Stomping Slabs was revealed this way, Stomping Slabs deals 7 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : If a card named Stomping Slabs wasn't revealed this way, Stomping Slabs deals no damage to its target.

card.name: Stonehewer Giant
card.ability:
Vigilance
{1}{W}, {T}: Search your library for an Equipment card and put it onto the battlefield. Attach it to a creature you control. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "No matter how strong, an unarmed fighter is no more than a fool."
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : This ability doesn't target a creature. You may attach the Equipment to a creature that has shroud, for example. However, the creature must be able to be legally equipped by the Equipment. You can't attach the Equipment to a creature that has protection from artifacts, for example.
4/1/2008 : If there is no legal creature for you to attach the Equipment to, it remains on the battlefield unattached.

card.name: Stonybrook Banneret
card.ability:
Islandwalk
Merfolk spells and Wizard spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.flavor: Made from trout scales and crawfish whiskers, merrows' shimmering banners flash in the water like lightning.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : A spell you cast that's both creature types costs {1} less to cast, not {2} less.
4/1/2008 : The effect reduces the total cost of the spell, regardless of whether you chose to pay additional or alternative costs. For example, if you cast a Rogue spell by paying its prowl cost, Frogtosser Banneret causes that spell to cost {1} less.

card.name: Stonybrook Schoolmaster
card.ability: Whenever Stonybrook Schoolmaster becomes tapped, you may put a 1/1 blue Merfolk Wizard creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Merrow schools rarely form by design. They come together naturally as eager learners surround the wisest teachers.

card.name: Stream of Unconsciousness
card.ability: Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn. If you control a Wizard, draw a card.
card.flavor: Dreams are tempting because one is so powerful in them. Dreams are dangerous because that power is a lie.

card.name: Sunflare Shaman
card.ability: {1}{R}, {T}: Sunflare Shaman deals X damage to target creature or player and X damage to itself, where X is the number of Elemental cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: A spark to light the guttered heart.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If Sunflare Shaman leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, it will still deal damage to the targeted creature or player. If Sunflare Shaman is put into your graveyard, it even counts toward the amount of damage dealt.
4/1/2008 : If the target leaves the battlefield or otherwise becomes an illegal target before the ability resolves, the ability is countered and Sunflare Shaman won't deal any damage to itself.

card.name: Supreme Exemplar
card.ability:
Flying
Champion an Elemental (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elemental you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)

card.name: Swell of Courage
card.ability:
Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
Reinforce X—{X}{W}{W} ({X}{W}{W}, Discard this card: Put X +1/+1 counters on target creature.)
card.flavor:
"Tideshaping is more than creating a few
new puddles."

card.name: Taurean Mauler
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Taurean Mauler.
card.flavor: The power of a waterfall. The fury of an avalanche. The intellect of a gale-force wind.

card.name: Thieves' Fortune
card.ability:
Prowl {U} (You may cast this for its prowl cost if you dealt combat damage to a player this turn with a Rogue.)
Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Thornbite Staff
card.ability:
Equipped creature has "{2}, {T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player" and "Whenever a creature dies, untap this creature."
Whenever a Shaman creature enters the battlefield, you may attach Thornbite Staff to it.
Equip {4}
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : Each of these Equipment has two subtypes listed on its type line. The first one is a creature type, which in this case is also a subtype of tribal. The second one is Equipment, which is a subtype of artifact.
4/1/2008 : Each of these Equipment has a triggered ability that says "Whenever a [creature type] creature enters the battlefield, you may attach [this Equipment] to it." This triggers whenever any creature of the specified creature type enters the battlefield, no matter who controls it. You may attach your Equipment to another player's creature this way, even though you can't do so with the equip ability.
4/1/2008 : If you attach an Equipment you control to another player's creature, you retain control of the Equipment, but you don't control the creature. Only you can activate the Equipment's equip ability, and if the Equipment's ability triggers again, you choose whether to move the Equipment. Only the creature's controller can activate any activated abilities the Equipment grants to the creature, and "you" in any abilities granted to the creature refers to that player.

card.name: Titan's Revenge
card.ability: Titan's Revenge deals X damage to target creature or player. Clash with an opponent. If you win, return Titan's Revenge to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If you win the clash, the spell moves from the stack to your hand as part of its resolution. It never hits the graveyard. If you don't win the clash, the spell is put into the graveyard from the stack as normal.
4/1/2008 : If the spell is countered for any reason (for example, if all its targets become illegal), none of its effects happen. There is no clash, and the spell card won't be returned to your hand.

card.name: Unstoppable Ash
card.ability:
Trample
Champion a Treefolk or Warrior (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Treefolk or Warrior you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, it gets +0/+5 until end of turn.

card.name: Vendilion Clique
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
When Vendilion Clique enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand. You may choose a nonland card from it. If you do, that player reveals the chosen card, puts it on the bottom of his or her library, then draws a card.

card.name: Vengeful Firebrand
card.ability:
Vengeful Firebrand has haste as long as a Warrior card is in your graveyard.
{R}: Vengeful Firebrand gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The flame of a warrior is never extinguished.

card.name: Veteran's Armaments
card.ability:
Equipped creature has "Whenever this creature attacks or blocks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each attacking creature."
Whenever a Soldier creature enters the battlefield, you may attach Veteran's Armaments to it.
Equip {2}

card.name: Violet Pall
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature. Put a 1/1 black Faerie Rogue creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: A faerie is the offspring of Oona and mischief.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : You get the token, not the player who controlled the creature.

card.name: Wandering Graybeard
card.ability: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Wandering Graybeard, you may reveal it. If you do, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor: His tales are as tall as he is, and only a giant's life is long enough to listen to them all.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : Kinship is an ability word that indicates a group of similar triggered abilities that appear on _Morningtide_ creatures. It doesn't have any special rules associated with it.
4/1/2008 : The first two sentences of every kinship ability are the same (except for the creature's name). Only the last sentence varies from one kinship ability to the next.
4/1/2008 : You don't have to reveal the top card of your library, even if it shares a creature type with the creature that has the kinship ability.
4/1/2008 : After the kinship ability finishes resolving, the card you looked at remains on top of your library.
4/1/2008 : If you have multiple creatures with kinship abilities, each triggers and resolves separately. You'll look at the same card for each one, unless you have some method of shuffling your library or moving that card to a different zone.
4/1/2008 : If the top card of your library is already revealed (due to Magus of the Future, for example), you still have the option to reveal it or not as part of a kinship ability's effect.

card.name: Warren Weirding
card.ability: Target player sacrifices a creature. If a Goblin is sacrificed this way, that player puts two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens onto the battlefield, and those tokens gain haste until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"And that's when it was discovered that boggarts have just half a brain."
—The Book of Other Folk

card.name: War-Spike Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{R}: War-Spike Changeling gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Aren't there boggarts enough in Lorwyn? Couldn't it turn into a sheep? Or a sunflower?"
—Olly of Goldmeadow

card.name: Waterspout Weavers
card.ability: Kinship — At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it shares a creature type with Waterspout Weavers, you may reveal it. If you do, each creature you control gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Weed-Pruner Poplar
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, target creature other than Weed-Pruner Poplar gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"When Byoog reached down to pull up a bit of root for the stew, he didn't expect the root to pull back."
—A tale of Auntie Wort
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : The ability is mandatory. If you're the only player who controls any other creatures, you must target one of your own creatures with the ability.

card.name: Weight of Conscience
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
Tap two untapped creatures you control that share a creature type: Exile enchanted creature.
card.flavor: Sometimes the weight of the world on your shoulders is a literal one.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : Since the activated ability doesn't have a tap symbol in its cost, you can tap creatures that haven't been under your control since your most recent turn began to pay the cost.
4/1/2008 : The ability exile the enchanted creature, but Weight of Conscience remains on the battlefield. The Aura will then be put into your graveyard as a state-based action.

card.name: Weirding Shaman
card.ability: {3}{B}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Put two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: All boggarts have an auntie, but they don't all have a mum.
